data.title: McClelland and Stewart Ltd. fonds
data.text:
Finding aids for the series are as follows, with the accruals that they cover noted in brackets. The series are linked here and to the right to aid in browsing. However, as many areas overlap, researchers will find Ctrl+F/Cmd+F helpful in locating material throughout the archive:

Series A - President (1-3rd accruals, addenda)

Series C - Editorial Department (1-3rd accruals, addenda)

Series D - Executive VP (1st accrual, addenda)

Series F - Controller (1st accrual, addenda)

Series G - General Ledgers (addenda)

Series H - VP Special Sales (1st accrual)

Series I - Inventory (addenda)

Series J - Marketing (1st accrual, addenda)

Series S - General Manager (addenda)

Series T - Contracts, royalties, and permissions (1st accruall, addenda)

Series U - Subsidiaries and Agencies (1st accruall, addenda)

Series V - Canadian Centennial Library (1st accruall, addenda)

Series X - Manuscript Inventory

Series - Catalogues (addenda)

Series - George L. Parker (4th accrual)

Series - Donald Roper (5th accrual)

Series - Douglas Gibson (6-11th accruals)

McClelland & Stewart Ltd. First accrual. – 1949-1975. – 23.6 m of textual records and graphic material.

Series A: President, predominantly Jack McClelland correspondence.

Number of files over one are noted. Researchers should consult the miscellaneous files which do contain correspondence with or about authors, even if they have files of their own.

Arrangement, alpha sequence, Boxes 1-64 (first shipment); followed by a second alpha sequences, Boxes 65-70 (second shipment); followed by Boxes 70a-c (formerly Series B). Arrangement is usually by author, but it some cases it is by book title, company name, or subject.
